title: Any chance to appeal a perma ban?
body:
Long story short, I was toxic last game (and a few games prior) and got perma banned. I *probably* did deserve it, but I didn't use any racism or homophobic slurs and I didn't tell anyone to kill themselves


Is there any chance I can appeal the ban? I'm not saying I shouldn't have been banned, I guess I'm more or less asking for clemency or mercy, some sort of second chance I guess.

replies.body:
There are 4 tiers of punishments:

1.) 10 game chat restriction
2.) 25 game chat restriction
3.) 14 day ban
4.) Permanent ban

You start at tier 1 and every subsequent offense moves you up one tier (though it is possible to drop tiers if you go long enough without a punishment). So, if you have recently received a 14 day ban, then I'm sorry to say that you're not going to get the permanent ban lifted. A permanent ban is the next step after the 14 day ban, and you're even warned when you get the 14 day ban that your next punishment would be a permanent ban. At this point, you've already received multiple chances to change your behavior, and you refused to do so.

If you haven't received a 14 day ban recently, then it _might_ be possible to have your punishment reduced, but you will need to contact [Player Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and ask them about it. If they say no, then you're out of luck.
Unless it was done by mistake/error of the system; no
You already got plenty of warnings, you ignored them. So logically you have no intention or ability to reform.
